p: Temperature is one of the key climatic variables affecting plant distributions [ 18, 19, 20, 21]. The mean annual temperature and precipitation of the Falkland Islands is 6.6Â°C and 559 mm, respectively [ 16], however, there are significant climatic gradients across the Islands in both temperature and precipitation [ 16]. Within the Falkland Islands, there is a subset of species with distributions associated with particular temperature ranges [ 7]; it is these range-restricted species that form the focus of our study.
